result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J Hunter Moncree

1:34 PM Defendant Brandon James Hunter-Moncree in court.  Attorney Charles Donald Wingrove in court for Brandon James Hunter-Moncree.  Attorney Andrea M Will appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire/Waiver filed in Court today.
Probable cause found/Deft bound over.
Atty Wingrove requests not to proceed to arraignment today, requesting a date after Jan. 5th, when Deft's other case is set to resolve.
Court will allow this case to resolve in Branch 2.
Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on January 11, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

10:49 AM Defendant Brandon James Hunter-Moncree appeared by phone.  Attorney Charles Donald Wingrove appeared by phone for Brandon James Hunter-Moncree.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is not ready to proceed today, Atty has been exposed to Covid.
Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
(warrant was authorized on 9.27.22)

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Comply with day reporting requirements; Monitor drug/alcohol abstinence-device to be determined by day reporting staff.

3:15 PM Defendant Brandon James Hunter-Moncree in court.  Attorney Charles Donald Wingrove in court for Brandon James Hunter-Moncree.  Attorney Andrea M Will appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Court vacates warrant-court reinstates bond.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Return on warrant on September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

4:34 PM Defendant Brandon James Hunter-Moncree not in court.  Attorney Charles Donald Wingrove in court for Brandon James Hunter-Moncree.  Attorney Andrea M Will appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Atty Wingrove tried to reach client and was not able to reach him. State requests a capias and forfeiture of bond, but informs the Court deft did appear in Br2 for plea and a sentencing date has been set for January. Court issues bench warrant but does not forfeit bond. Atty Wingrove states Frank-Mann issue in complaint and requests Court wait 72 hrs to sign warrant. Court will be at conference next 3 days and Ct Comm can hear rtn of warrant if necessary.
Appointment of Special Prosecutor under Chapter 978 Order signed by the Court 9.20.22 appointing Atty Andrea Will.
Appointment of Special Prosecutor under Chapter 978

3:48 PM Defendant Brandon James Hunter-Moncree in court. Attorney Charles Donald Wingrove in court for Brandon James Hunter-Moncree.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Wingrove believes the DA's office should disqualify themselves in this matter.
Court agrees that a special prosecutor is necessary & requests a Waukesha Cty prosecutor.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
Status conference on September 27, 2022 at 04:30 pm.
to Disqualify
